items.title: [stdlib] Drop some @available(introduced:...)
items.body: These annotations make it hard to write code that works in both Swift 3 and Swift 4, so if they aren't needed we should remove them.

items.title: [CS] Use ConstraintSystem::getType.
[Exclusivity] Don't suggest copying to a local when swapAt() is appro…
items.body:
…priate

Update static exclusivity diagnostics to not suggest copying to a local
when a call to swapAt() should be used instead. We already emit a FixIt in
this case, so don't suggest an an helpful fix in the diagnostic.

rdar://problem/32296784

items.body:

items.title: Change typeCheckExpression() to return Type.
items.body:
Doing this allows us to return ErrorType in some circumstances where we
want to communicate that we don't have a usable type rather than writing
ErrorType directly into the type of the expression root, avoiding a
mutation of the expression tree in a failure case.

items.title: Don't look through arbitrary open-existentials in the bridging peephole
items.body:
When looking for non-bridging conversions to peephole into a contextual conversion, make sure we don't peek through open-existentials.

Crashers here look like:

```
Assertion failed: (SGF.OpaqueValues.count(E) && "Didn't bind OpaqueValueExpr"), function visitOpaqueValueExpr, file lib/SILGen/SILGenExpr.cpp, line 4480.
```

with something like this in the backtrace:

```
19 swift 0x000000010d341593 swift::Lowering::SILGenFunction::emitRValueAsSingleValue(swift::Expr*, swift::Lowering::SGFContext) + 83
20 swift 0x000000010d364300 tryEmitAsBridgingConversion(swift::Lowering::SILGenFunction&, swift::Expr*, bool, swift::Lowering::SGFContext)::$_1::operator()(swift::Lowering::SILGenFunction&, swift::SILLocation, swift::Lowering::SGFContext) const + 48
```

Fixes rdar://33341584 (possibly only partially).

items.title: Fix up comment for typeCheckExpression.
[swift-4.0-branch] Improve usability of NSItemProvider APIs for bridgeable types
items.body:
* Explanation: Improves usability of the Drag-n-Drop APIs with the types that can be bridged between ObjC and Swift (String, URL, Data, etc.)
* Scope of Issue: Additive change, as the old overloads are still available
* Risk: Minimal
* Reviewed By: Dave Rahardja
* Testing: Automated test suite with the new cases
* Directions for QA: N/A
* Radar: <rdar://problem/33354388>

items.title: Handle IUO unwraps in key paths.
items.body: In the type checker, we need to recognize when a member lookup succeeded through an IUO unwrap, and insert the implicit optional-unwrap component into the key path. In the standard library, we need to cope with the fact that IUO is still a first-class type with unique type metadata in a few places. Fix for rdar://problem/33230845.

items.title: [4.0] Handle IUO unwraps in key paths.
items.body:
Explanation: The compiler would crash when a key path literal included an implicit unwrap of an IUO.

Scope: Fixes a crash using key paths with IUO properties

Issue: rdar://problem/33230845

Risk: Low, bug fix isolated to key paths

Testing: Swift CI

items.title: [stdlib] Make String.UTF8View bidirectional
items.body: This is a step along the way toward handling backward-compatiblity of UTF8View slicing and preventing inadvertent creation of String instances that keep inaccessible memory alive.

items.title: Remove imports of SILModule.h from files that don't need it.
items.body: No functionality change.

items.title: SILGen: Remove unused catch block for a try? expr using SGF.eraseBasicBlock().
items.body: Erasing the block directly from its parent using bb->eraseFromParent() doesn't update SILGenFunction's internal state tracking the postmatter section of the function. Fixes SR-1333 | rdar://problem/33351098.

items.title: [4.0] SILGen: Remove unused catch block for a try? expr using SGF.eraseBasicBlock().
items.body:
Explanation: A `try?` expression that didn't include any throwing in its subexpression would corrupt SILGen's internal state, leading to compiler crashes.

Scope of issue: Because it's an internal consistency issue, some code that happened to seem to work with Swift 3.1 releases will now crash in 4.0 builds, leading to regressions.

Issue: SR-1333, rdar://problem/33351098

Risk: Low, one-line bug fix

Testing: Swift CI, test cases from Jira

items.title: Cleanup dead configuration code for copy-on-write existentials
items.body: Copy-on-write existentials are enabled and none of these flags are used

items.title: Fix DeclContext::printContext to emit a single hex prefix "0x".
[sil-opaque-values] Add SILGen support for opaque values in a handful of places.
[4.0] [ClangImporter] Add direct access for import-as-member types.
items.body:
- **Explanation**: If a Swift library contains an extension of Objective-C type `A` that has a method that mentions Objective-C type `A.B` (using the "import-as-member" feature), performing the lookup to find `A.B` can lead to a circular dependency between deserialization and the importer, which resulted in a compiler crash. This is not a new problem, but it's more important with the release of Swift 4, where a number of Apple SDK types are now newly imported as member types. (The one in the original bug was NSView.AutoresizingMask, formerly NSAutoresizingMaskOptions.) This change adds a "fast path" for direct lookup of a single, unambiguous type nested in an Objective-C type.
- **Scope**: Affects references in Swift to nested types imported from Objective-C.
- **Issue**: [SR-5284](https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-5284) / rdar://problem/32926560
- **Reviewed by**: @milseman (ClangImporter), @jckarter (Serialization)
- **Risk**: Medium-low. These types are not uncommon, but this is just a "fast path"; it should fall back to the old code if it fails.
- **Testing**: Added regression tests, verified that the original test case now passes, passed the source compatibility suite on master.

items.title: [CS] Use the type map in eraseOpenedExistentials.
Lower Never-typed patterns to unreachable
items.body:
Cuts off a crash in SILGen for switches over uninhabited types.
We can take this a step further and extend the definition of
"uninhabited" to product types with uninhabited components.

// CC @rintaro

items.title: swift-api-digester: Avoid considering a type decl is removed if a typealias with the same name is simultaneously added. rdar://33307864
[Serialization] Use the correct module for the nested type fast path.
items.body:
Fix-up for #10956, which fixes the crash caused by the new test case I thought of slightly too late.

More [SR-5284](https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-5284) / rdar://problem/32926560.

items.title: [silgen] Fix a few uses of UnownedRetain, UnownedRelease, StrongRetai…
items.body:
[silgen] Fix a few uses of UnownedRetain, UnownedRelease, StrongRetainUnowned in favor of their ownership counterparts.

The counterparts are:

UnownedRetain -> CopyValue.
UnownedRelease -> DestroyValue.
StrongRetainUnowned -> CopyUnownedValue.

I thought I hit all of these already. When I was fixing some DI stuff I realized
that I missed a few cases in SILGenLValue.cpp. To make sure we do not regress, I
added some verifier checks to make sure these instructions can only be used in
non-ownership sil.

rdar://31880847

items.title: [gardening] Reduce indentation of SILGenLValue::visitRec by inverting an if condition.
items.body:
[gardening] Reduce indentation of SILGenLValue::visitRec by inverting an if condition.

The issue here is that the way the code was structured caused a large
conditional block at the beginning of the function that always exited early and
then a short unconditional block.

This commit inverts the if statement so that the short unconditional block is
now conditional and the large conditional block is unconditional, reducing the
overall indentation for the majority of the function.

items.title: [di] Show the swift code necessary to generate some of the derived self cases.
items.body:
[di] Show the swift code necessary to generate some of the derived self cases.

This will make it easier to understand how these test cases come up in the wild.

rdar://31880847

items.title: [4.0][stdlib] Fix array slice self-assignment bug
items.body:
Cherry pick of #10958 onto the 4.0 branch.

* Explanation: When fast-pathing in-place slice mutation, bounds check the slice's ranges match exactly. In-place mutation of an array slice doesn't need assigning back, but there needs to be a check that the assigned slice's bounds matches otherwise unmatched range assignments like `a[1..<1] = a[1..<2]` were getting thrown away.
* Scope of Issue: Correctness fix
* Risk: Minimal. This is checking for a potential no-op fast path. When the check fails, the full `replaceRange` method is called, writing the slice into the collection in full. This is what is desired in this case.
* Reviewed By: Dave Abrahams
* Testing: Automated test suite + new tests for this case

items.title: Large Types IRGen Pass: return large types as @out
items.body:
radar rdar://problem/28680453

Change the result type to an `@out` argument instead of a new `@inout` argument per @rjmccall 's suggestion on https://github.com/apple/swift/pull/10771

items.title: Fix a pair of bugs with variadic subscripts
items.body:
Fix a SILGen bug with variadic subscripts that I recently introduced and a CSApply bug with variadic tuple subscripts that I did not.

The SILGen bug was exposed by the source-compat test suite as part of rdar://33341584.

items.title: NSKeyed{Una,A}rchiver should support Codable
items.body:
Adds ability to encode/decode Codables via new methods:
- encodeEncodable
- decodeDecodable
- decodeTopLevelDecodable

Adds unit tests for the same.

Radar: 30472067

items.title: SILGen: Ease off +0 peepholes for load exprs.
items.body: Now that we more tightly close formal accesses on lvalues, having LoadExpr and friends try to return a +0 loaded value is unsafe without deeper analysis, since the access will be closed immediately after the load and potentially free temporary memory that might be the only thing keeping the borrowed object alive. Fixes rdar://problem/32730865.
